p: L. radula is also a shrub, native of the Andean region and growing between 2000 and 2500 m above sea level. This plant is described with the accepted name Sphacele radula Benth. [ 15] and three botanical synonyms are known: Alguelagum cordifolium (Benth.) Kuntze, Alguelagum radula (Benth.) Kuntze and Sphacele cordifolia Benth [ 16]. The plant has been described in Ecuador in the provinces of Azuay and Loja [ 17]. An EO composition of this species has already been reported in the literature [ 18].
